heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm fell at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour over the 144.8 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 34.3mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 09 November 2025, it lasted 144.8 hours and it delivered 47.89mm of rain at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 3 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.6.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 0 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (196°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 27 January 2026 with a value of 128.2 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: It is currently one of the longest windy periods.  It is the ranked 5th since our records started in 23 September 2024.  There have been 4 consecutive days where it has been windy starting on 02 February 2026.  The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%) and rainfall (up 1.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 352 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 125 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 351.6m lower than yesterday, 122.5m lower than the past week, 125.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 530m and a peak of 1993m, averaging 659.2m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: Fog or low cloud is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, the air will feel dry and very little to no wind will be present. Some rain can be expected, fog or low cloud is expected, and overcast conditions will limit sunlight. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
